content: Gotta agree with the other reviews about the stat checks; they are really punishing, especially if you want to beat the last fight. Also having a DLC just to increase your stats is pretty scummy.

This game isn't good, it's barely presentable at best. With how praised it is, it hugely underperforms all expectations I had. One of the many issues it has is "show, not tell." Through the relation meter, they hint that you're close to the person but you'll know nothing about them. The biggest offender is your caretaker who's made to be important but has shown none of the interaction to warrant it. No investment=Drop Also, LegacyAdvantage is a cashgrab and the only way to get a satisfying end.
Fantastic story the choices had me restarting over and over it reminds me of a classic d and d experience oh you that that would work nope not on this boss lol love it

Great game can play over and over squire, priestess, wizard, guard, hunter, druid, knight, assassin, a ton of options great replay value. The 2nd and 3rd books are equally amazing! There are even more options in those! Most games I've bought I wish I hadn't wasted the money,but not this. Totally worth it!
I barely read this this wasnt the book i was gonna buy can i get a refund

Perfect game to play if your D&D session is canceled. Some choices that seem frivolous can actually lead you to secrets you'd have missed, worth playing multiple times and worth trying different character builds.
Very interactive and AWSOME
Well written story set in a way to tell the struggle of the protagonist. Good read!
Great story!

I actually purchased this book. Great story with fantastic lore and excellent stats. This is such an epic story! Every character is relatable and unique. This game has multiple romance options as well. This is one of the best choice of games out there and this one happens to be a trilogy as well. Highly recommend.

Very rushed and stat-based. Quite poor character interactions. Bought the Legacy Advantage too and it pretty much did nothing besides dropping some serious gold. Might be me creating a character not suited for greatness, so three stars it is.
It kinda let me down, I paid the i think it was like $6 to download the game and the story was a let down, still a good game but not worth $6
Playing this somehow makes me tired, unlike the other interactive novels..
Its amazing

it was a nice story, short though, but long if you try multiple endings and roles. Didn't know I haven't reviewed this. If you guys didnt know this novel have a lot of roles to pick(knight, archer, druid, mage, bard, thief, etc.) and more on book 2 and 3. And like I said, the story is short but enjoyable to repeat, since all roles have different side quest and stories(cause I've been seeing a lot of comments of this novel being short). Its worth your time I promise.

I wasn't a huge fan of this one. It's REALLY short for starters, and the class system and skill system is really fun but the skillchecks are really arbitrary and difficult to understand. It feels like a lot of your choices don't really have an impact regardless, but at the same time it's really easy to screw up and lose out on something major. I was just confused and frustrated for most of it and I tried playing a few times. Meh. Waste of a few bucks.
The game/story was enjoyable at best but way too short. Over all, I'd rate it 7/10 with 3 out of 5 stars
Good
Cool story line !!!
The amount of playthrough I can choose in this fantasy is simply astonishing!
LOVED IT
it is a fun game but it isn't worth three dollars I mean it ended so fast. it's a great game but its kinda a scam 11

I bought this game for 2.99 and upon opening it the game says I need to buy it for 1.99, even though its already been purchased. I have emailed the support team 3 times and so far no response. I will update if I get a response but for now im annoyed. I just want to play the game I purchased. UPDATE: I did get a response which clarified some of the issues I was having but since I had already made the additional 1.99 purchase I couldnt try to "fix" my origional issue. But its fine and Im neutral.
Ph3nominal game with massive replay value
Its actually so worth everything. Not too hard or easy and branches out so well. Both the dlc or not is still worth its money.
I re-downloaded it after awhile to replay it but it says I did not purchase it and I will not purchase it again I feel like I'm being ripped off
Awesome
One of the best games of this type. Very high freedom of choice, wonderful implementation RPG elements, especially the job system.
An interesting concept, but I think it was too short and every skill check was too hard for my character despite training those skills.
A pretty good story I'd say
so good

The trilogy kept me busy for weeks ! Fantastic
I really liked the story. but I think its bogus that I can only play this once. when I want to replay it makes me pay again.
A must play, one of the best series I've played, second only to the Sabres of Infinity series
one of the best examples of choice games so many hidden paths and i love it

great story options, would like a way to get rid of old or in unused save files though
The perfect start to a great series
Best series of all the CoG games ive played it more times than i can count.
This series is one of the best interactive stories I have played. I believe these three stories are the best of the author's work and a must play.
purchased but not restored
an enjoyable as well as addictive hope for more books like it
Nevermind I'm an idiot
great gamr but it was a little short
great stories, can't fault anything about all three. they quickly became my favourite hosted stories, played through them all at least 10 times 😂
I had fun all the way through. Loved the characters and the adventure.
this game was able to get me through a week of boredom in the field
I love this series, but have one problem. the legacy advantage has to be paid for, but you already have to pay for the game.
You can't Load your save game from Lost Heir 1 to Lost Heir 2 or 3.

Best Series I ever played out of the over games on Hosted Games and Choice of Games. Great addictive story, dialogue and gameplay that I didn't want it to end too soon. You earn my full approval, good job
Great game albeit very hard for its type.

I love this series! I've replayed it at least 10 times and it's my favourite out of any of the Choices games. I have all 3 games and the DLC purchased and I considered all of them more than worth it. The replay value is incredible. I only wish there was some sort of guide, because I really want to get an Enchanted Archer but I'm struggling. The guide I was using (unaffliated) also doesn't include the new DLC so it's hard to get through it. But that's my only complaint and doesn't really have anything to do with the quality of the game itself. If you're not a guides person unlike me, it's perfect!
Loved it
Wow, simply wow... It has been a long time since I have been blown away by a story this amazing.
Great storyline, and options really keep you on your toes.
It's very very cool, but I don't get why it won't let me open Theo's box when I have 23 Devices, a lockpick set, and it only requires 20...

One of the more difficult hosted games released to play vanilla. Of the three books I think this game is the most balanced in terms of the viable play styles and has the best character development. The game's main story is linear, with the "side quests" adding flavor to the play style you chose for your character.  Choices are basically stat checks, with successes being rewarding and failures punishing.   In a sense this game is "immersive", you are not a god/goddess amongst men. You have more weaknesses than strengths, which makes your choices VERY important. Even if you pour all your effort into one stat, that stat won't be used in every situation, and if you spread your stats out too much you won't be strong enough to pull through when you need a higher stat.  The charm of this game is the difficulty, the struggle is part of this game. You could say this is the "dark souls" of interactive novels, when victory is based on intimate knowledge of the game rather than luck.   The legacy dlc is highkey pay2win, adding mostly to stat boosts, and very little to narrative and world building. For those who complain about the difficulty there you go.

I would love the game and feel at ease playing through it. But the high skill checks ruin the experience as I am unable to play the character I want. Sometimes I am unable to do anything and continue blind due to these skill checks. In which I receive few points compared to the high skill checks.

Another absolutely amazing interactive novel by Mike Walter, bravo! In all seriousness everyone should purchase all of his interactive novels - the playthrough combinations are endless and the stories are not only rich and exciting, but fully customizable to your personal style!

Well written and thought out. It does a wonderful job of balancing a readers ability to manipulate the story with a good plot line and great writing. Something of this quality is one in a dozen. It is set at a fairly good price for its size comparatively, however is still a bit short as a whole this series is a masterpiece.

Holy hell, you need to chill with the skill checks in this game. I can't 
even play the kind of character i want because he is constantly getting 
defeated from a skill check that wasn't at all related to the playthrough i 
was going for. Out of all the Hosted games I've played, this was the most 
disappointing and unsatisfying one

Took me a couple of replays to love this series, but boy do I ever. It is 
one of the only Hosted that pulls off having a large assortment of PC 
stats. If you're smart with them can tackle multiple skills without getting 
screwed later or you can specialize without crippling your PC's viability. 
Such a good series.

I simply couldn't find any fun in playing this. In order to get successful 
choices you need massive skill checks in four or five skills, this means if 
you want to be successful you have to constantly balance stats instead of 
simply playing the game how you want and enjoying yourself

I love the lost heir, how it is different from other choice games is that 
your choice really matters and I like how it arrives balance to even out 
the gameplay for the character's skills. I love the romance events too, 
personally I find Jace so difficult but his heart event is cute. Overall,I 
am just literally addicted to this game.

Quite a good idea. Story runs smooth. Unfortunately, I believe its shorter 
than other novels...

"The sun begins to rise in the WEST, illuminating the many carts carrying the newly made Demonstones..." lol the sun rises from the west in this world??? Double check your facts please. Other than that, great intro into a grand tale!

Great game i loved it but can any one tell me how A become a paladin and B find some more relics please i know how to get the nature necklace and the the strange amulet and the shield but what of the rest
Class does not matter as much as stats. Go for options that provide the most stat growth. High stats in everything are needed in book 3.
You can't do really well in this game unless you pick certain options early, it claims to allow you to play multiple ways but the game is stacked towards certain paths
Story doesn't change like at all aside from side quest. Your character is a bumbling idiot and it's cohorts suck just as bad.
Amazing story
Great!

I really love your games expecially these ones and life of a wizard. If anyones having trouble bytry "multiclassing". Such as being a priest who uses magic so you can always fight with your spells, or use you god to heal or curse, and this will give you a high arcana and religion which are extremely useful. This is just one of the useful combinations I found and I'm sure there are plenty more.
I adore this series- it's definitely my favorite adventure game of all time

I loved the story if they had another similar to this one I would love to play/read it the story was really engaging I could definitely see my decision play out and bite me in the but as they often did lol overall a great story and I would recommend it to anyone who likes a good story and fantasy
Interesting
I'm in love with Theo.

A solid interactive story. The choices matters and the game continue even if you don't choose the correct choice. Which is really great. There was some things which bothered me though : - lot of stats doesn't progress when you fail. Which give a really bad taste in my mouth. You doesn't have the correct outcome AND you doesn't progress stat-wise. (While the challenges begin increasingly more difficult). Don't we say what doesn't kill is makes us stronger ? And that you learn best by your mistakes ? I really think it's a bad design. Because you are forced from the first choice to choose what you want to do and you can't change during the story (and forget about being a jack of all trades) - This is more a amelioration than a problem but when you show the number, why don't you show them before making a choice ? That way we could be able to make a choice while really knowing g what they do, instead of having to guess our gain. It'll not spoil us about the difficulty of a task nor if the stats we choose are useful for the ending we want but it'll make the choices less random when two choices both appalling arrive. (And it'll help for the new game+)  I still give this game 5 stars because it's good but should be these two point answered, this game would be a staple !
The game had a great story but the skill requirements to do things requires min/max. Which sucks but otherwise great game and I had a lot of fun. Playing out.

I like the series but the only thing about this I hate is that all the skill checks are far to high and I failed just about everyone and It made me not want to play at times. Other than that everything was great. I'd deffinentlt suggest getting the trilogy.

Great story but one MAJOR issue is the skills not enough chances to raise them so you practically fail every check and it becomes quite annoying and no fun which is why I will not be continuing to lost heir 2.

The Lost Heir Triology is my favorite choice of game without a doubt. Great story, great ending, some very endearing characters and a lot of replayability value. I have finished the triology as a Dragon Knight, Paladin, Rune Warrior, Druid, Alchemist, Arcane Tattooist, Berserker, Vampire Lord, Bard and Knight. There are still so many classes left to try out. I am mainly looking forward to playing as a Luck Mage, Dark Knight, Necromancer, Elemental Archer and Demon Summoner next. There are the other regular fantasy mainstays like Assassin, Thief, Priest, Cleric, Ranger, Guard etc as well.
I loved it!

Storyline love it but what I don't understand is what is the point of using email to save point when you finish and when to try to use so called email to continue in the second half of story it says Error every time... So useless so I have no choice but to make a new character...
Best of the best. Can't wait for the final instalment!
Amazing :)

U shouldnt try to make a balanced character. Balanced character is half-baked which mean you wont pass skill check. Try focus on one thing. If magic then focus on magic and if weapon focus on the weapon. Well if you repeatedly play for hours then you wont have a problem.
Totally enjoyable

It's a good story with one major issue. The problem I have with this read is that you're forced to Min/Max in order to get anything done. Want to play a spellsword? Get ready to fail every other skill check!
Well written story, but the absurd skill checks definitely require min/max. Greatly appreciated the vast romance options.
This game love it. The best. Unbeatable.
My only complaint is the length, yeah three bucks isn't much but for every three to four hours you pay three bucks for the next book.  Otherwise a good time waster with a fun story
Can't wait for third one
I loved it! I love the romance in this too.
Entertaining and challenging! Writing is great and the story is enjoyable.

By far the best game I've played from this publisher, and this would be my third. Very thought provoking stat system and decision trees. Immersive writing and likeable characters, I hope to see them become more fleshed out in future games.     I am very much eager to move onto part 2 after only two separate clears.
Really fun... there's no other words to describe this game.

It has a wonderful, classic fantasy setting with well developed characters and choices in the building of your character that adds immersion and replayability. I honestly have a billion saves between this game and the sequel and am waiting patiently for the third game.
Feels like a ciff hanger

The point of a game is for enjoyment not disappointment. Need to work on character development. You can only increase your stats be mere couple of points but you need at least 50 just to make one decision.same thing with life of a mobster and life of a wizard. I have played this game for over 2 hrs and restarted numours times and still can't do one thing that I want.
the states are hard to work with and im annoyed i paid money for 1/3 a game...
I can't stop replaying!
Absolutely incredible!

I loved the story it was engaging and well thought out. The characters were well developed and their were plenty of choices and all relevant to the story. My only gripe is that some of the choices have to high of a skill level and there doesn't seem to be enough chances to develop some of the skills. I like the fact the even when u fail you still get options usually that's the end of the story. I'm definitely buying the second part, I want to see where the story goes.

I purchased this on a whim and it's probably one of my favorite purchases I've made on my phone. The story is so varied and it feels like your choices really matter. Like having a game of DnD in your pocket. The way it connects to the sequel leaves you completely invested. I can't wait for part 3!

My biggest problem is the high skill checks. Makes me feel like earlier Stat boost choices are for not. Min Maxing of a few stats not just required but optimal thanks to the checks. 2nd is the linear story with your only differences being what you  can do based on your "class" which slightly affect outcomes (whether you fail or not), last the length. I know it's 1 of 3, but the arc in this I felt it could have been better, fuller. Still good enough read to want the next chapter.
The right mix of fun and difficult.
Work on your writing.
I never read a book in my adult life. I couldn't stop reading this......
How do I even romance that dang soulburner

.5 stars minus cos abit on the short side. This series are easily in my Top 10 must buy. Choices do affect your character, skills n abilities. If u enjoy Hero Project . This is a must get cos its a sequel. Theres part 2 for this n i just finished Part 2 which is awesome.

But it gives you choices to do  even though you'll fail, life of mobster and life of wizard isn't like that if you can't do it, it'll be greyed out, also shorter than I thought kinda just ends, but everything else is great bout it.
I can't find the option to save my progress in case i did something wrong and I don't want to restart my progress
Read the title
Great story albeit on the short side. Like the way you can influence the stats through your choice.

I have no complaint. My money was well spent on the first two parts and I believe it will remain so when I buy the third when it comes out. The game was well done, and I'm quite amazed on how much you can do in it. The stats are manageable and it was fun building on relationships, the small fights, and artifact raiding. Just make smart decisions and all will be well. Fun, good story, and enjoyable.
Got this game when it first came out very great game interesting fun overall entertaining
This game is amazing! Great writing and story!

One of the more interesting and well made stories for mobile! Only complaint that I have is that you should put more feeling into your character when something bad happens to her/him. Make him or her cry and such. It will make the story all the better!
Interesting premise and set up. Well written too but extremely short. Got through the story in under an hour. Free CoG last longer so for $2.99, was disappointed

Nothing you do matters or has any influence on anything. The few things you can influence have such high stat requirements that it becomes more like a test to make sure you clicked on all the right meaningless choices to get there...and you'll die constantly. Like all the time over and over. I got through the story mostly by dying through it. Banal and annoying. The person who wrote it can write but can't make a game to save their lives.
Many opportunities for play through trying to acquire the most rare items...

Another great game by Lucid. Stats aren't actually that hard to manage just choose your base stats well and from there the little increases just add up over time (it's actually quite easy to max a few stats to 100, and since this is a Trilogy... You're going to have these stat checks you can never fail) The story itself is good and the writing has definitely improved from Life of a Wizard. (Another great game just more RPG elements). Was definitely worth the money for me.
Truly a great game. Reminds me of Life of a Wizard,  which is my favorite Choice Of style game, but this one does a much better job of making the characters and plot feel more alive.
Seriously. My favorite game in the genre.
I can't wait for the next one! And my review is very unhelpful!
Yes the story is a bit short but I absolutely love it. I can't wait for the rest of the series.
Need to get  book 2  out soon

This is one of my absolute favorite interactive novels available for android--and I've played pretty much everything available in English that costs 5$ or less! Choice of Games, Hosted, a few independants, you name it. This one was AWESOME. Can't wait to see more from this author (hopefully a sequel?)!!
Love it
Good story but the characters were a little linear and more opportunities to train would have been good. Perhaps that comes with the next chapters ... seems to be taking a while to release.
Simple it cut off white abruptly the sooner the sequel the better.
Extremely short. Skills are not leveled in a way where you can succeed when realistically you should be able to. And what the hell is with making you pay for each part when they're that short?
While it can be fun at times, it's simply too dull, with not enough excitement.
I liked the story and it kept interesting. It definitely leaves you hanging though. Looking forward to the next one.
Great game can't wait for the next part
The rating system is too strict
One of the best interactive novels I've found.
Try it!
Cant wait for the second one
This is the best one I have played. Highly interactive and meaningful choices. Please do more !!!

It's pretty short. Not in that it's a small, self contained story but rather in that it's just not complete, ending in the middle of a bigger narrative. The worst thing is the strategy required. You're forced to min max stats if you want to be even partially effective, and some times that's not enough.
I have had an amazing time with this one.
A lot of fun with a lot of replay value. I can't wait for the sequel to come out!
The story is good but the way the stats are designed makes it impossible to do anything. You should definitely fix this

One of the best choice of games. Really want to see the sequels.

I like the game. I felt like some of the choices you make. The stat was too high causing you to fail or get injured. Hopefully in the sequel the game takes care of that. I am a fan of Mike Walter. I just liked the stat system in Life Of Wizard better.
Unlike the other works by the author this one just seems unfinished. I know there is two more parts but this one just does not grab you.

Played through 10 different characters so far and may still make another. I made an evil priest! I almost never make evil characters but I still enjoyed the evil character as much as the good ones. Keep'em coming.

For a choose your own adventure game is more than fine. Worth the price. However, with a game from this author I went in expecting a lot more depth of story and character. The priest/paladin is a disappointing stereotype.
Wish it had more stat choices, like life of a wizard, I felt like I always ended up getting injured or failed somehow no matter what I chose. But still, get it, it's amazing quality, you'll love it.

Eventhough the story is very enjoyable, but the price is not suitable for it compare to your previous release. Please for next chapter, hope that you can make the price exceptable for the length of the text.

I realize certain choices gives more advantage than others and certain class leads to epic stats hoarding, playing as a hunter thief, i manage to get all 8 artifacts i otherwise cant with my mage or warrior... even so the artifacts were so much hunter oriented i had near perfect stats in things i desired, there should be alternatives in loot aquisitions as solely relying on 1 stats for certain artifact is very limiting to loot and stats hoarders... hopefully part 2 and 3 have more artifacts variants
It was short... Way short and there arent that many content to begin with.
But i t leaves with a cliff hanger plz guys at least make the game have a discount for the second one

It's so short and it ends really abruptly. Plus its impossible to do anything because the stats are really weird. Seriously I've played so many times but the stats are a mess and you can't even interact with people properly as a result. I mean you need to meet huge requirements for basic desicions, yet your stat increases are always so small. It makes it impossible to really do anything that you want to do. The whole thing is stupid and needs a guide. I'd get a refund but it's too late.
It's a good game and I enjoyed it really but what I don't like is that it ends in a cliff Hanger

Fairly impressed. Here's to hoping that your evil route is going to be really evil. Certainly the stat building is one of the better ones I've seen out of many CoGs.  I believe it's a bug that you will automatically enter a relationship status with Thea even though you did not make a move on her. I believe it's the high level of relationship points that affect that.  I'm not sure if it's a good idea to limit Jess' relationship path so much that you MUST make a good relationship point start with her. I mean like c'mon, let me rob them blind and still be able to woo Jess (ironic since she's the Soulburner, the supposedly 'bad' and discriminated person in the universe) since I can do that to the others!  I'm not sure if it's intended that you 'corrupt' Thea at the beginning by doing cold-blooded murder, and during the dancing festival have a different partner, whisper to them to steal the rings - which should have them condemning me and fail me - but resulted in a success and refers to this particular beginning. Which kinda is wrong in my opinion.  Other than that, it's a great CoG.

It's an enjoyable story, with interesting options. Though I'm disappointed by the high requirements for most choices. The small stat increase seems to push you down set paths, rather than the path you choose.
Can't wait for next game
Well thought out game can't wait for the next one.
It was just too short for the amount i paid. The character development could be better, even if it's just the first part of the series.
this game has the same feel as the Life of a Wizard interactive story and this is a good thing - anyone who has enjoyed a tabletop role playing game (like D&D) will love this
I enjoyed this game. Has a good story with a decent length i cant wait to finish the story in the sequels
Huge fan of Lucid. This is good work. It's just not a full story. I don't mind break things into three parts. But each part still needs an arc. This is a bit short of a first act resolution.

I've been playing Choice of Game's stories for a while and I think this is one of the best. Can't wait for the next part. Although it would be nice to have an in-game save system too because of the long gameplay.
Looking good so far. I love games which have 2 or 3 parts and u can transfer ur stats
